intro: Ruellia ciliosa var. hybrida, commonly known as the hybrid ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub or herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. Ruellia ciliosa var. hybrida is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as butterflies and bees.
